name: Shin Masou Kishin: Panzer Warfare
overview: Shin Masou Kishin: Panzer Warfare is a Strategy game, developed and published by Banpresto, which was released in Japan in 1999. Super Robot Wars is a series of tactical role-playing video games produced by the Japanese gaming company, Banpresto, a division of Bandai, for various video game consoles and video game handheld consoles. The games' main feature is the use of mecha units from multiple Japanese anime and manga titles, mixing them together in a battle simulation and adding a complex plot involving some of their respective storylines, characters, and backgrounds. Another feature is a simple menu interface that can be understood by the gamer, even if he or she does not know how to read Japanese. It is loosely based on original characters and the Cybuster mecha from the video game series Super Robot Wars. The gameplay is the usual in a tactical RPG game: The player have a limited range of movement for each turn and when he's hear an enemy he can attack it. In the attacks the game make a close-up view to view the attacks results. Full-scale simulation RPG's Subjects robot anime tradition flow of "Super Robot Wars" series "Masou Cybaster God". Masou knights will fight again for the stage world of fictional "A Angeles", to regain peace. Based on the system of "Super Robot Wars" series, I have adopted the system with enhanced tactics of more. Features: Third person perspective. 2D graphics Cartoon graphics SCI-FI & Futuristic themes.
